rows.title: How to close/hide the Android soft keyboard programmatically?
Transpose / reshape dataframe without "timevar" from long to wide format
How to filter object array based on attributes?

501: <p>From what I know,  add an <code>__init__.py</code> file directly in the folder of the functions you want  to  import  will do  the job.</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python">root
   dir_a
      file_a.py
      file_xx.py
   dir_b
      file_b.py
      file_yy.py
   dir_c
   dir_n
</code></pre>
<p>You can add the parent directory to <code>PYTHONPATH</code>, in order to achieve that, you can use OS depending path in the "module search path" which is listed in <code>sys.path</code>. So you can easily add the parent directory like following:</p>
<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-comment"># file_b.py</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> sys
sys.path.insert(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'..'</span>)

<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> dir_a.file_a <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> func_name
</code></pre>
502:
<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>t = [<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">6</span>, <span class="hljs-number">7</span>, <span class="hljs-number">8</span>]
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>t
[<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">6</span>, <span class="hljs-number">7</span>, <span class="hljs-number">8</span>]
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>s = []
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> i <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> t:
       <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> i <span class="hljs-keyword">not</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> s:
          s.append(i)
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>s
[<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">6</span>, <span class="hljs-number">7</span>, <span class="hljs-number">8</span>]
</code></pre>

<p>Try using sets:</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> sets
t = sets.<span class="hljs-type">Set</span>([<span class="hljs-string">'a'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'b'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'c'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'d'</span>])
t1 = sets.<span class="hljs-type">Set</span>([<span class="hljs-string">'a'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'b'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'c'</span>])

<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span> t | t1
<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span> t - t1
</code></pre>

<p>I've compared the various suggestions with <a href="https://github.com/nschloe/perfplot" rel="noreferrer">perfplot</a>. It turns out that, if the input array doesn't have duplicate elements, all methods are more or less equally fast, independently of whether the input data is a Python list or a NumPy array.</p>
<p><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/bM7Qf.png" rel="noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/bM7Qf.png" alt="enter image description here"></a></p>
<p>If the input array is large, but contains just one unique element, then the <code>set</code>, <code>dict</code> and <code>np.unique</code> methods are costant-time <em>if the input data is a list</em>. If it's a NumPy array, <code>np.unique</code> is about 10 times faster than the other alternatives.</p>
<p><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/giJyZ.png" rel="noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/giJyZ.png" alt="enter image description here"></a></p>
<p>It's somewhat surprising to me that those are not constant-time operations, too.</p>
<hr>
<p>Code to reproduce the plots:</p>
<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> perfplot
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> numpy <span class="hljs-keyword">as</span> np
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> matplotlib.pyplot <span class="hljs-keyword">as</span> plt


<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">setup_list</span>(<span class="hljs-params">n</span>):
    <span class="hljs-comment"># return list(np.random.permutation(np.arange(n)))</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> [<span class="hljs-number">0</span>] * n


<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">setup_np_array</span>(<span class="hljs-params">n</span>):
    <span class="hljs-comment"># return np.random.permutation(np.arange(n))</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> np.zeros(n, dtype=<span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>)


<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">list_set</span>(<span class="hljs-params">data</span>):
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">list</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">set</span>(data))


<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">numpy_unique</span>(<span class="hljs-params">data</span>):
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> np.unique(data)


<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">list_dict</span>(<span class="hljs-params">data</span>):
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">list</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">dict</span>.fromkeys(data))


b = perfplot.bench(
    setup=[
        setup_list,
        setup_list,
        setup_list,
        setup_np_array,
        setup_np_array,
        setup_np_array,
    ],
    kernels=[list_set, numpy_unique, list_dict, list_set, numpy_unique, list_dict],
    labels=[
        <span class="hljs-string">"list(set(lst))"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-string">"np.unique(lst)"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-string">"list(dict(lst))"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-string">"list(set(arr))"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-string">"np.unique(arr)"</span>,
        <span class="hljs-string">"list(dict(arr))"</span>,
    ],
    n_range=[<span class="hljs-number">2</span> ** k <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> k <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(<span class="hljs-number">23</span>)],
    xlabel=<span class="hljs-string">"len(array)"</span>,
    equality_check=<span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,
)
<span class="hljs-comment"># plt.title("input array = [0, 1, 2,..., n]")</span>
plt.title(<span class="hljs-string">"input array = [0, 0,..., 0]"</span>)
b.save(<span class="hljs-string">"out.png"</span>)
b.show()
</code></pre>

<p>Without using set </p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python">data=[<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">6</span>, <span class="hljs-number">7</span>, <span class="hljs-number">8</span>]
uni_data=[]
<span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> dat <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> data:
    <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> dat <span class="hljs-keyword">not</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> uni_data:
        uni_data.append(dat)

<span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(uni_data) 
</code></pre>
505:
<p>Thank God its officially supported <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=acC7SR1EXsI" rel="noreferrer">after 11 years</a></p>
<p>First add dependency <code>implementation 'androidx.core:core-ktx:1.7.0'</code> to app gradle</p>
<p><strong>Here is the simple <a href="https://github.com/sergchil/KeyboardTest" rel="noreferrer">project</a> on github</strong></p>
<pre class="default s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-kotlin"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> android.app.Activity
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> android.content.Context
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> android.view.View
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> androidx.core.view.WindowInsetsCompat
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> androidx.core.view.WindowInsetsControllerCompat
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity


<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">fun</span> View.<span class="hljs-title">showKeyboard</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span></span> = (<span class="hljs-keyword">this</span>.context <span class="hljs-keyword">as</span>? Activity)?.showKeyboard()
<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">fun</span> View.<span class="hljs-title">hideKeyboard</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span></span> = (<span class="hljs-keyword">this</span>.context <span class="hljs-keyword">as</span>? Activity)?.hideKeyboard()

<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">fun</span> Fragment.<span class="hljs-title">showKeyboard</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span></span> = activity?.let(FragmentActivity::showKeyboard)
<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">fun</span> Fragment.<span class="hljs-title">hideKeyboard</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span></span> = activity?.hideKeyboard()

<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">fun</span> Context.<span class="hljs-title">showKeyboard</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span></span> = (<span class="hljs-keyword">this</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">as</span>? Activity)?.showKeyboard()
<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">fun</span> Context.<span class="hljs-title">hideKeyboard</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span></span> = (<span class="hljs-keyword">this</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">as</span>? Activity)?.hideKeyboard()

<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">fun</span> Activity.<span class="hljs-title">showKeyboard</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span></span> = WindowInsetsControllerCompat(window, window.decorView).show(WindowInsetsCompat.Type.ime())
<span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">fun</span> Activity.<span class="hljs-title">hideKeyboard</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span></span> = WindowInsetsControllerCompat(window, window.decorView).hide(WindowInsetsCompat.Type.ime())
</code></pre>
